body:
test **failed**.
refer to this link for build results: https://ci.owncloud.org/job/pull-request-analyser/2435/
@schiesbn can you remind me what this was about ?

this function is used to get the user even if no user is logged in (e.g. public uploads). until now i only tested it with the files app where we always use a stream, so testing for ```user/files``` was enough. but the documents app uses files_put_content if someone edits a document shared by a public link. in this case we first write to ```/user/cache``` since we removed the etmp files. therefore we also need to check for "cache" to get the user from the path.

test **failed**.
refer to this link for build results: https://ci.owncloud.org/job/pull-request-analyser/2436/
tests failed... please have a look.
the failed tests are not related to the changes i did here. i also can't reproduce them locally... let's retry.
@owncloud-bot retest this please

> the failed tests are not related to the changes i did here. i also can't reproduce them locally... let's retry.

just reproduced the failure locally:

any idea why?

if i run the webdav tests alone, everything works fine.

also happens for me.
running:

    ./autotest.sh sqlite

i just set up a complete fresh installation from core. the tests fail at the same position. i checked the code and the method test\user\session::callback() doesn't exists here? how can this work for on any system?

> the tests fail at the same position.

i cannot confirm this - jenkins on master is fine and locally tests are fine as well.
looks like it's getting time for some x-mas holidays :wink:

ok i think i got it: @schiesbn was running the tests directly on the branch and @deepdiver1975 rebased/merged the branch with master.

i'll rebase this onto master now so we are on the same page.

test **failed**.
refer to this link for build results: https://ci.owncloud.org/job/pull-request-analyser/2444/

rebased.

and nope... i've got two different environments.
on opensuse 13.1 + branch and master,  i get the results that @schiesbn wrote before.
on ubuntu 12.04 and this branch and master, i get the results from @deepdiver1975 
on ubuntu 12.04 and master, no issues

on opensuse 13.1 i have phpunit 3.6.4
on ubuntu it's 3.7.28.
jenkins has 3.7.21
@schiesbn has 3.6.10

i've now upgraded to 3.7.21 and prepared this https://github.com/owncloud/core/pull/6515
tldr; upgrade to phpunit 3.7 and we're all be on the same page :wink:

if i remove the unit tests, all tests run but one.

    1) test_encryption_share::testpublicsharefile
    exception: encryption key not found for "/test-share-user1/files/share-tmp.test" during attempted read via stream

anyway, i'll try enabling your code piece by piece until the weird error appears again...

shouldn't the public-keys folder be empty before `setupbeforeclass` is called ?
there seem to be old keys there... but probably not the reason for the failing.

i suspect there might be a hook from a previous test that wasn't unregistered.
i'm not sure how to fix this, does my explanation make sense @schiesbn ?
hmm but still strange that the test runs correctly when only helper.php is tested :frowning:

ok, i've debugged into it in both cases:
1) when running all the tests: there is an extra hook getting called on postdelete that tries to delete the public key, but the fs isn't available at this time (probably because of the `teardownfs` from `logouthelper`)
2) when running only the `helper.php` test, there is no such hook.

now how to find out which other test set that hook and didn't clean it up...
too bad we don't have a phpunit bisect (which runs all possible combinations (but not permutations) of tests)
something in `setup` or `teardown` part of the `crypt.php` test is breaking it.

i have now only one dummy test that does nothing in `crypt.php` and if i comment out the call to `registeruserhooks` in `setupbeforeclass`, it doesn't break the helper.php tests any more.

@schiesbn please look into unregistering/clearing these hooks in `teardownbeforeclass`.

test **failed**.
refer to this link for build results: https://ci.owncloud.org/job/pull-request-analyser/2448/

test passed.
refer to this link for build results: https://ci.owncloud.org/job/pull-request-analyser/2451/

yea, jenkins finished and all tests passed!

will squash the last commits together and than wait for your final reviews!

so in the end you still didn't clear the hooks in crypt.php...

anyway :+1: 

i'm preparing a testlistener to identify dirty tests.
